column4: I've got a mystery here. "ssh user@localip" works fine. however, "scp user@localip:/path ." apparently interprets localip as a domain name!
you didnt mention the file to be copied
it shoud be like scp file_name ser@localip:/path
it shoud be like scp file_name user@localip:/path
ubuntulog: no, the command I gave was fine as I wrote it (assuming /path leads to a file, which it does)
67.215.65.132 is an OpenDNS ip, which is what I use for dns
which makes me think that scp tried to resolve LOCAL_IP at opendns, and opendns returned its generic error ip address in response
nfrs:I see, you checked for host entries too?
also, ping LOCAL_IP works fine, too
local IP is your machine IP itself or some other IP in your LAN?
you really should change your nick name :)
wats with log and sage? couldnt  find any similarity ;)
